00019 #ifndef TLM_ARRAY_HEADER
00020 #define TLM_ARRAY_HEADER
00021 
00022 //
00023 // To the LRM writer: the below class is an artifact of the tlm_generic_payload
00024 //                    implementation and not part of the core TLM standard
00025 //
00026 
00027 #include <systemc>
00028 #include <exception>
00029 // unused for the time being: #include <assert.h>
00030 
00031 // This implements a lean and fast array class that supports array expansion on
00032 // request. The class is primarily used in the tlm_generic_payload class for
00033 // storing the pointers to the extensions.
00034 //
00035 // Individual array elements can be accessed through the [] operators, and the
00036 // array length is returned by the size() method.
00037 //
00038 // The size can be dynamically expanded using the expand(uint) method. There
00039 // is no shrinking mechanism implemented, because the extension mechanism
00040 // does not require this feature. Bear in mind that calling the expand method
00041 // may invalidate all direct pointers into the m_data array.
00042 
00043 template <typename T>
00044 class tlm_array
00045 {
00046 public:
00047 
00048     // constructor:
00049     tlm_array(unsigned int size = 0, T default_value = 0)
00050         : m_data(0)
00051         , m_size(0)
00052         , m_default(default_value)
00053     {
00054         expand(size);
00055     }
00056 
00057     // copy constructor:
00058     tlm_array(const tlm_array& orig)
00059     {
00060         m_size = orig.size();
00061         if (m_size>0)
00062         {
00063             try {
00064                 m_data = new T[m_size];
00065             }
00066             catch (std::exception &e) {
00067                 report_error(e); return;
00068             }
00069             for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_size; i++)
00070             {
00071                 m_data[i] = orig.m_data[i];
00072             }
00073         }
00074     }
00075 
00076     // destructor:
00077     ~tlm_array()
00078     {
00079         if (m_size>0) delete[] m_data;
00080         m_size = 0;
00081     }
00082 
00083     // operators for dereferencing:
00084     T& operator[](const unsigned int index)
00085     {
00086         // assert(index < m_size);
00087         return m_data[index];
00088     }
00089     const T& operator[](const unsigned int index) const
00090     {
00091         // assert(index < m_size);
00092         return m_data[index];
00093     }
00094 
00095     // array size:
00096     unsigned int size() const {return m_size;}
00097 
00098     // expand the array if needed:
00099     void expand(unsigned int new_size)
00100     {
00101         if (new_size > m_size)
00102         {
00103             unsigned int i;
00104             if(m_size==0)
00105             {
00106                 try {
00107                     m_data = new T[new_size];
00108                 }
00109                 catch (std::exception &e) {
00110                     report_error(e); return;
00111                 }
00112                 for(i=0; i<new_size; i++)
00113                 {
00114                     m_data[i] = m_default;
00115                 }
00116                 m_size = new_size;
00117             }
00118             else
00119             {
00120                 T* tmp = m_data;
00121                 try {
00122                     m_data = new T[new_size];
00123                 }
00124                 catch (std::exception &e) {
00125                     report_error(e); return;
00126                 }
00127                 for(i=0; i<m_size; i++)
00128                 {
00129                     m_data[i] = tmp[i];
00130                 }
00131                 for(i=m_size; i<new_size; i++)
00132                 {
00133                     m_data[i] = m_default;
00134                 }
00135                 m_size = new_size;
00136                 delete[] tmp;
00137             }
00138         }
00139     }
00140 
00141     static const char* const kind_string;
00142     const char* kind() const { return kind_string; }
00143 
00144 protected:
00145     T* m_data;
00146     unsigned int m_size;
00147     T m_default;
00148 
00149     // disabled:
00150     tlm_array& operator=(const tlm_array<T>&);
00151     
00152     // Report allocation error:
00153     void report_error(std::exception &e)
00154     {
00155         std::string msg("Allocation of array failed: ");
00156         msg += e.what();
00157         SC_REPORT_FATAL(kind_string, msg.c_str());
00158     }
00159 };
00160 
00161 
00162 template <typename T>
00163 const char* const tlm_array<T>::kind_string = "tlm_array";
00164 
00165 #endif /* TLM_ARRAY_HEADER */
